comment.author: 22051825@N03
comment._content: The correct spelling is "Stortingsbygningen" - The Norwegian Parliament Building

comment.author: 85667083@N00
comment._content: The contemporary spelling is Stortinget/Stortingsbygningen, but the old one is Storthinget, according to Ivar Aasen But of course, for searching Flickr, Stortinget is the best spelling. Here is some more images of Stortinget This photo, btw, is probably taken from Grand Hotel. Here is the relation between these two buildings sorrounding Eidsvolls Plass (square) So this image of Grand Hotel on Karl Johans Gate (usually called Karl Johan), in your collection is taken from Stortinget. And thanks for a super stream and sharing these photos! Please encourage every other library and museum.

comment.author: 34265026@N05
comment._content: Also notice the building on the right, it is the Freemasons building in Oslo. 3d

comment.author: 22248241@N03
comment._content:
The Parliament building was finished in 1866.
The Freemasons building, as mentioned, was build somewhere mid 1890's so the photo was probably taken late 1890's.

comment.author: 34389967@N05
comment._content:
The Storting (Stortinget, literally "the Grand Assembly / Thing") is the Norwegian Parliament, and is located in the capital city Oslo. The Storting building was completed in 1866 and was designed by the Swedish architect Emil Victor Langlet.

Did you know ...
That the speakers gavel is made out of maple wood originating from George Washington's estate in Virginia, USA?

comment.author: 34428100@N04
comment._content: This is what you see from the window in the Mikado suite in Grand Hotel 2009. Almost the same angle.

comment.author: 87696453@N00
comment._content: The park you see in the old photograph was replaced by "Spikersuppa" (The (iron)nail soup) in 1956. Oslo took over the area in 1889 and the plans for it were developed by architect Arnstein Arneberg. The reason for the name Spikersuppa was that it was funded by Christiania spigerverk (nail factory). More in Norwegian here: no.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eidsvolls_plass_(Oslo)
